column4: is it possible to REMOVE 'hibernation' entry from system shutdown dialog?
hey guys, how do i remove 'hibernation' entry from system shutdown dialog window?
babo//can you get to the terminal? if it is possible try reinstalling gnome :)
babo// sudo apt-get purge gnome-desktop (am i right about that package name?) and then sudo apt-get install gnome-desktop... it could work maybe.
and can someone help me with this... removing hibernation option from system shutdown menu?? :)
you might have to edit gnome's source code for that but not sure
could be somewhere in gconf-editor too
do i have to manually save settings when i mess around with this ... gconf-editor?
I dont think so
it worked! thanks! :) unchecked can_hibernate and it is gone forever from system shutdown dialog!
does mint use gnome?
yes it is gnome
System->preferences->keyboard shortcuts
gnome-keybinding-properties

click on show panel menu under the Desktop section
that brings up the 'gnome menu', not 'mint menu'... :)
